news_header: NASA is launching a mission to explore Jupiter's moon Europa for signs of liquid water and potential life.
news_text: On Monday, NASA will launch a mission to investigate Europa, one of Jupiter's moons, which scientists believe may have a structure similar to Earth. The mission aims to determine the presence of liquid water and signs of life beneath Europa's icy surface. The journey will take at least five and a half years, with the launch scheduled from Cape Canaveral, Florida, using SpaceX's Falcon Heavy.
